body:
After I Installed energyplus v8-3-0, honeybee still warns that i have to have energyplus v8-1-0. I couldn't find the earlier version for it. 

Should I install exactly the version 8-1-0 to make it function?

I think honeybee cannot recognize the newer version of energyplus. 

I've tried to change the name of the folder to "8-1-0". It generated some problems.

Need solutions.

Thanks!

replies.body: Hi Xinyi. You need to use a newer version of Honeybee. Update Ladybug+Honeybee and try again. Here is how > [http://hydrashare.github.io/hydra/viewer?owner=mostaphaRoudsari&amp...;](http://hydrashare.github.io/hydra/viewer?owner=mostaphaRoudsari&fork=hydra_1&id=Update_Ladybug_and_Honeybee)

hy mostapha,, i'm nubie with grasshopper :( ....how if i just change this script v8-1-0 with v8-4-0? actually honneybee can recognize that file, but can you tell me what kind of problem can generated with that??  Thank's mostapha... [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/AI-C-DD*hSe84NxTHvooi-7npBbe9gc0RHQczLgiIv2TzuyLbkMCgfiP3wzTRug4ZuVFtywdWITM*GQXi3gyhDdAuv7TKvFp/Untitled.png)

Hi Moose! I haven't checked the updates in EnergyPlus 8.4. There might be some issues in loading the results as they may have changed output names. Otherwise it's usually fine. If you [update Ladybug and Honeybee](http://hydrashare.github.io/hydra/viewer?owner=mostaphaRoudsari&fork=hydra_1&id=Update_Ladybug_and_Honeybee) the latest version works by EP 8.3 by default.

Hi Mostapha, I also have the same problem with Xinyi, but unfortunately the GH definition that i downloaded from your link cannot work. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/JGWHmZoi22D9anQEU29yKZBITDc0w934ligdTkpr4la9GKyzTp6sh832bwz8dTSSX8Ejw6sZEOv3U12lbxPPM*tMCvrPXP7-/20160105_173825.jpg) Do you have any suggestion or probably i've missed some of the procedure of the updating.. Thank in advanced best, Dani

Hi Dani, The error is because the component cannot create a new folder under Ladybug default directory. Can you change the default folder for Ladybug similar to how you're doing it for Honeybee? That should solve the problem.
